metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10800 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
When GraphicsMagick 1.3.25 processes a MATLAB image in coders/mat.c, it canlead to a denial of service (OOM) in ReadMATImage() if the size specifiedfor a MAT Object is larger than the actual amount of data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10800` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-1').
